title: Add Unity Network App download section and UnityNodes media-kit logos (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Add a prominent, mobile-responsive download section on the public landing page with outbound links to Google Play and Apple App Store.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays a clearly labeled section offering both Google Play and Apple App Store links.
Both links use the exact URLs provided and open in a new tab (target="_blank") with rel="noopener noreferrer".
Section layout is responsive on small screens (buttons/badges stack and remain readable/tappable).

file_operations.description: Create a reusable public-facing "Get the Unity Network App" section component with responsive layout (stacked on mobile, side-by-side on larger screens) and two external links using the exact provided store URLs with target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer".
Wire the new GetUnityNetworkAppSection into the public Landing page (prominent placement, at minimum on the landing page) and ensure it is visually distinct from existing hero/features/CTA sections.

requirements.summary: Add UnityNodes media-kit logo assets and app store badge graphics as static public assets and render at least one logo in the public UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Logos from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html are added to the repo under a public static assets directory (frontend/public/...).
The site renders at least one of the downloaded logo assets in a public-facing section (e.g., the download section).
No backend endpoints are added/used to serve these images.

file_operations.description: Add the UnityNodes logo wordmark image as a static public asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/unitynodes-logo-wordmark.dim_1200x300.png (downloaded from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html).
Add the UnityNodes logo mark/icon image as a static public asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/unitynodes-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png (downloaded from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html).
Add the Google Play badge graphic as a static public asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/google-play-badge.dim_512x152.png.
Add the Apple App Store badge graphic as a static public asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/app-store-badge.dim_512x152.png.

Update the download section component to render at least one UnityNodes logo asset (e.g., frontend/public/assets/generated/unitynodes-logo-wordmark.dim_1200x300.png) and use the store badge images (frontend/public/assets/generated/google-play-badge.dim_512x152.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/app-store-badge.dim_512x152.png) as the primary tappable link visuals. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure English copy clearly labels app store links as external destinations and avoids implying the Unity mobile app runs on ICP.
acceptanceCriteria: Download section includes English copy that makes it clear the user is going to external app store pages.
Copy does not state or imply the Unity mobile app is ICP-powered.
All added/updated user-facing text for this change is English.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust English user-facing copy around the download buttons/logos to explicitly state the links go to external app store pages and to avoid any claim or implication that the Unity Network mobile app itself is ICP-powered (only the website/marketplace may be ICP-powered).
Ensure surrounding Landing page context near the download section remains consistent with the clarified messaging (English-only text and no implication that the Unity mobile app runs on ICP).
